verses.verse: Now the serpent <WH5175> was <WH1961> more subtle <WH6175> than any beast <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> which Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> had made <WH6213>. And he said <WH559> unto the woman <WH802>, Yea <WH637>, hath God <WH430> said <WH559>, Ye shall not eat <WH398> of any tree <WH6086> of the garden <WH1588>?
And the woman <WH802> said <WH559> unto the serpent <WH5175>, Of the fruit <WH6529> of the trees <WH6086> of the garden <WH1588> we may eat <WH398>:

but of the fruit <WH6529> of the tree <WH6086> which is in the midst <WH8432> of the garden <WH1588>, God <WH430> hath said <WH559>, Ye shall not eat <WH398> of it <WH5060>, neither shall ye touch it <WH6435>, lest ye die <WH4191>.
And the serpent <WH5175> said <WH559> unto the woman <WH802>, Ye shall not surely <WH4191> die <WH4191>:

for God <WH430> doth know <WH3045> that in the day <WH3117> ye eat <WH398> thereof <WH5869>, then your eyes shall be opened <WH6491>, and ye shall be as God <WH430>, knowing <WH3045> good <WH2896> and evil <WH7451>.

And when the woman <WH802> saw <WH7200> that the tree <WH6086> was good <WH2896> for food <WH3978>, and that it <WH1931> was a delight <WH8378> to the eyes <WH5869>, and that the tree <WH6086> was to be desired <WH2530> to make one wise <WH7919>, she took <WH3947> of the fruit thereof <WH6529>, and did eat <WH398>; and she gave <WH5414> also <WH1571> unto her husband <WH376> with her <WH398>, and he did eat.

And the eyes <WH5869> of them both <WH8147> were opened <WH6491>, and they <WH1992> knew <WH3045> that they were naked <WH5903>; and they sewed <WH8609> fig8384, 5929 -leaves together <WH8609>, and made themselves <WH6213> aprons <WH2290>.

And they heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> walking <WH1980> in the garden <WH1588> in the cool <WH7307> of the day <WH3117>: and the man <WH120> and his wife <WH802> hid themselves <WH2244> from the presence <WH6440> of Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> amongst <WH8432> the trees <WH6086> of the garden <WH1588>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> called <WH7121> unto the man <WH120>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH335>, Where art thou?
And he said <WH559>, I heard <WH8085> thy voice <WH6963> in the garden <WH1588>, and I was afraid <WH3372>, because I <WH595> was naked <WH5903>; and I hid myself <WH2244>.

And he said <WH559>, Who <WH4310> told <WH5046> thee that thou wast naked <WH5903>? Hast thou eaten <WH398> of the tree <WH6086>, whereof I commanded thee <WH6680> that thou shouldest not <WH1115> eat <WH398>?
And the man <WH120> said <WH559>, The woman <WH802> whom thou gavest <WH5414> to be with me <WH5978>, she <WH1931> gave <WH5414> me of the tree <WH6086>, and I did eat <WH398>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> unto the woman <WH802>, What is this thou hast done <WH6213>? And the woman <WH802> said <WH559>, The serpent <WH5175> beguiled me <WH5377>, and I did eat <WH398>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> unto the serpent <WH5175>, Because thou <WH859> hast done <WH6213> this <WH779>, cursed art thou above all cattle <WH929>, and above every beast <WH2416> of the field <WH7704>; upon thy belly <WH1512> shalt thou go <WH3212>, and dust <WH6083> shalt thou eat <WH398> all the days <WH3117> of thy life <WH2416>:

and I will put <WH7896> enmity <WH342> between thee and the woman <WH802>, and between thy seed <WH2233> and her seed <WH2233>: he shall bruise <WH7779> thy head <WH7218>, and thou shalt bruise <WH7779> his heel <WH6119>.

Unto the woman <WH802> he said <WH559>, I will greatly <WH7235> multiply <WH7235> thy pain <WH6093> and thy conception <WH2032>; in pain <WH6089> thou shalt bring forth <WH3205> children <WH1121>; and thy desire <WH8669> shall be to thy husband <WH376>, and he shall rule over thee <WH4910>.

And unto Adam <WH121> he said <WH559>, Because thou hast hearkened <WH8085> unto the voice <WH6963> of thy wife <WH802>, and hast eaten <WH398> of the tree <WH6086>, of which <WH834> I commanded thee <WH6680>, saying <WH559>, Thou shalt not eat <WH398> of it <WH779>: cursed is the ground <WH127> for thy sake <WH6093>; in toil shalt thou eat <WH398> of it all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of thy life <WH2416>;
thorns also <WH6975> and thistles <WH1863> shall it bring forth <WH6779> to thee <WH398>; and thou shalt eat the herb <WH6212> of the field <WH7704>;

in the sweat <WH2188> of thy face <WH639> shalt thou eat <WH398> bread <WH3899>, till <WH5704> thou return <WH7725> unto the ground <WH127>; for out of it wast thou taken <WH3947>: for dust <WH6083> thou <WH859> art <WH6083>, and unto dust shalt thou return <WH7725>.
And the man <WH120> called <WH7121> his wife <WH802>'s name <WH8034> Eve <WH2332>; because she was the mother <WH517> of all living <WH2416>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> made <WH6213> for Adam <WH120> and for his wife <WH802> coats <WH3801> of skins <WH5785>, and clothed them <WH3847>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559>, Behold <WH2005>, the man <WH120> is become as one <WH259> of us <WH3045>, to know good <WH2896> and evil <WH7451>; and now <WH7971>, lest he put forth his hand <WH3027>, and take <WH3947> also of the tree <WH6086> of life <WH2416>, and eat <WH398>, and live <WH2425> for ever <WH5769>â€”
therefore Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> sent him forth <WH7971> from the garden <WH1588> of Eden <WH5731>, to till <WH5647> the ground <WH127> from whence he was taken <WH3947>.

So he drove out <WH1644> the man <WH120>; and he placed <WH7931> at the east <WH6924> of the garden <WH1588> of Eden <WH5731> the Cherubim <WH3742>, and the flame <WH3858> of a sword <WH2719> which turned every way <WH1870>, to keep <WH8104> the way <WH1870> of the tree <WH6086> of life <WH2416>.
